DGACM.relevance_comment: Text requests the Secretary‑General, as depositary, to open the Treaty for signature at United Nations Headquarters. DGACM’s programme (protocol, conference and meeting services) is the operational arm that implements such an instruction: PPB para. 2.1(d) (protocol services and host‑country liaison), para. 2.1(a)/(c) (conference‑servicing and secretariat support at Headquarters), and the subprogramme strategies for planning/coordination and meetings/publishing (see paras. 2.33 and 2.59) describe responsibility for organizing meetings, venue/registration and related conference services.

Text requests the Secretary‑General, as depositary, to report to the General Assembly at its fifty‑second session on the status of signature and ratifications. DGACM’s mandate to provide substantive/technical secretariat support and to prepare and issue parliamentary documentation (PPB paras. 2.1(a),(c); subprogramme 3 documentation services, para. 2.46) means it would play a central role in producing, translating, issuing and distributing the Secretary‑General’s report to the Assembly.
